Summary: House of Tweakers . This place should be shut down by the city of San Clemente it’s filthy not many surfers here just drug addict tweakers on an extended stay in a hostel that’s not being monitored by professional staff and management

I would highly recommend a stay at house of Trestles! The staff is really great. Especially Carol, she helped me to navigate my entry into the building upon arrival and offered assistance in various other ways. Great customer service. I have stayed in hostels on surf trips all over and this one is super fun. Everyone is chill and very friendly. There’s a full on kitchen, pool table, board rentals you can’t go wrong.
Room tip: Bring your own shower necessities and a happy vibe you’ll love it

Summary Heading: Avoid, horrible people run this place
Summary: do not stay here. this place totally screwed me. they told me i could book online but did not tell me that the place looks out of their online system at 8pm. they left me stranded with nowhere to go. absolutly the worst people i have ever met. absolutly avoid this heartless place. littirely the nastiest people i have encountered.

Summary Heading: Husband and I took a much needed trip to San Juan Capistrano, there we found a GEM: “House Of Trestles.” AMAZING Place!!
Summary: We have never stay anywhere like this, the hotel is like a community and very welcoming, the entire building is an art piece. If you enjoy art, this place is for you!! The environment left us feeling comfortable and relaxed, just what we needed. I plan to go back soon with my best friend for a “girls trip.”

I had a great stay. Met some wonderful people whom I will now keep in contact with can't get any better than that and Chris the general manager is awesome!!! it's good to go solo which I was it's good to go with friends but it's a very very cool place super down to earth and very comfortable.

Was out in the area for business and figured I would extend my trip over the weekend. Never been to San Clemente before, figured I'd book a hostel for more of a communal vibe plus I like the fact that they partner with surfers for (an additional charge) you can take lessons. Spent 3 nights in a private room. The room was great. The only thing I would mention as a "con" would be the highway noise. If you are a light sleeper I would suggest requesting a room that doesn't face the highway. Lee took me out Saturday for surf lessons. He spent a couple hours with me out in the water. As an extreme newbie to surfing he was extremely patient with me and was a great instructor to keep you motivated and pumped up both in and out of the water. Chris checked me in and out and was also

Summary Heading: House of Trestles -Best Hostel in California
Summary: House of trestles is filled with amazing and kind people who want nothing more than to make your stay as pleasant and meaningful as possible. From 2018 until now I have stayed here 3 times and it only gets better each stay. Thank you to Josh , Rose , Chris , Megan , Aaron , Welvis , Diego, Nestor and everyone else for making this stay so special.

Very rude manager.  Everybody there was high and had NO CLUE how to provide customer service.  You can smoke pot all day long but alcohol is not permitted.  Probably a good fit for a 16 year old!  Place seemed a bit seedy and dirty.  Did not want to stay

Staying in the House of Trestles has been an epic experience. The location is ideal -- close to the beaches, pier, shopping, and my favorite aspect, it is covered in art from around the world. All of the staff members have pleasant attitudes and the guests are family. I highly recommend to anyone traveling in the San Clemente area!
Room tip: All rooms offer a unique experience. I would recommend staying in any of them.

Summary: Very friendly, quiet and clean.  Great place to land when in San Clemente.  On the south side of town, close to the world class surf spots.  Super chill, great art.  WiFi a little spotty at times.  Great kitchen.

Outstanding customer service with an epic vibe, these guys are on point when they say, want you to feel is your house. Joshua and he's team are amazing humans spreading the positive vibes. Thank you so much for the hospitality,I will definitely see you guys again soon. They got everything you need for your surf trio, eletrical bikes ready to go, very knowledgeable staff about the surf report, surf boards to rent right there.

Summary Heading: Incredible Family unity At This Lace.
Summary: Stayed at the House for 10 wonderful days. Met and became friends with some great people there.R really cool vibe.Convenient to Beach. (San Clemente State Beach entrance is 2 blocks top,shops and restaurants.  Thomas and Dave Manager and co manager really went above and beyond in service. My first visit and defiantly not my last.

Summary Heading: Avoiding refund of my money on cancelled reservation
Summary: The property charged my card on a fully refundable reservation and still hasn't refunded it after I canceled it over a month ago. I have called and left several messages and sent emails. I actually spoke with someone twice and both times they hung up as soon as I mentioned I was calling about my refund. I understand the tourism industry is in hard times but that is no excuse for this type of unprofessional behavior.   I will be taking legal action soon which is unfortunate since I would have been willing to work with them if they would just speak to me or return my calls/email. When things do get better, karma might be against them.

We came during the COVID 19 pandemic. We were just winging this part of our vacation and opting to stay a little low key. We walked to the beach, down to the pier and even trolled around to do local resale and retail shopping.  We found great rocks at the beach and misc clothing items while shopping. We loved the art and community vibes. We feel like we found a treasure! We could have used stronger internet signal but .... it may have been weather related, as there was MUCH raining.

Summary Heading: Laid back, clean, and unique hotel.
Summary: Clean space, beautiful custom artwork from artists all over the world, kind staff, right by Trestles Beach. Iconic spot that even non-surfers can enjoy. Check in/out process was smooth with staff on site during business hours.

Summary Heading: Awesome California Vibe And A Sweet Coastal Town!
Summary: I've Been a Return Regular of  House Of Trestles after discovering it on a trip down to San Diego about a year ago. I drop in it at least once every other month and I'm always greeted like a family member. If you're a people person and enjoy networking good vibes it's all here. They have awesome gourmet coffee in the morning and you're going to always make at least one new friend. You're right in the middle of it.. You have a World Famous surf break right across the street and San Clemente is a interesting town to explore.

Summary Heading: Next to last stop on San Fran to San Diego cycle trip
Summary: Most fun and eclectic hostel I visited during my trip. Highly recommend. The staff was energized and helpful. The location was Excellent. The free breakfast was a nice treat. There were plenty of games, skateboard ramp and musical instruments to keep everyone entertained.

Summary Heading: Fun energy in a welcoming atmosphere
Summary: I had a quick stay of one night because I was helping a family member move to California. The space was very comfortable and clean. Such a nice casual feel. This is a surf culture youth hostel that is well run, safe, clean, and fun.

I booked into House of Trestles for a night thinking the location was perfect and that I could crash there and get a surf lesson.  I ended up enjoying every second in the place, it was full of a great bunch of people that were fun to spend time with. A ready made bunch of surf buddies for the beach or the bar!   The bunks were comfortable and the facilities were excellent. Plenty of showers and hot water and a great kitchen. The free continental breakfast was great to you going.   The highlight of both days was getting a surf lesson with Mariana she has to be not only an awesome instructor but the happiest person to be in the water with. It was an absolute pleasure and favourite surf of the year and I learned heaps!   Can't recommend a place more than saying I'm planning on a

Summary Heading: You call, They Answer The Phone!
Summary: There is a lot to recommend the House Of Trestles. Great vibe, great prices, nice accommodations, close to the beach. The manager, Thomas, was attentive and helped out with changes to scheduling, so good service there.

I had never stayed at a hostel before and this place was awesome! We had a private suite with our own security code that completely made me feel safe. The artwork is really cool! John and the rest of the staff were so welcoming and helpful. Our little family met Acquaintances from all over! We played ping pong, and hung out on the hammock!  Our dbl queen bunk bed was perfect comfortable and clean. We hand access to cook with utensils and cookware and a large refrigerator. In the morning the coffee and bagels were great! I fell in love with the house dog Hank. We will be suggesting this place to all of our friends. I hope to go back at least a couple times this year! This is a Gem! Thank you so much!

The facilities are great very clean and safe. Staff members were friendly my special thanks to  Thomas  helpful with the check in Process and my questions related to surf and places to go to purchase good surf gear. I will stop by for sure on my next trip to Trestles Best  Regards, Lucas

Helpful staff happy to help Friendly visitors  Nice clean beds and amenities   We made a ton of new friends and enjoyed our stay so much we are already planning next summer !   Thank you for having us we can’t wait to return

Best hostel I’ve ever stayed in. The place was very clean and organised, had rules but wasn’t too strict. I met heaps of friendly people and the beds in the shared rooms and good curtains for privacy. The kitchen was awesome, living room was fantastic. Five stars, will be returning when I’m next in the US

The Good: Nice people, both staff and guests. Loved the community environment, common areas, art, musical instruments, over all vibe. Appreciated it being kid /family/ dog friendly which is hard to find when traveling. Good sized apartment that was much better to stay in for multiple nights than a 2 bed hotel room. Breakfast and Coffee was awesome. Great location close to the beach. Quiet.  Comfortable Beds.  The Bad: Room was not throughly cleaned prior to check in, examples: Hair and sand was in tub at check in Unknown splatter on toilet tank near handle (I cleaned with dish soap and paper towels). Only 2 towels for family of 4, got an extra towel on third day. Oven was broken Countertop in kitchen had crumbs and dirt when wiped down with baby wipe.  The Ugly: The room smelled

Had an amazing experience last summer during my stay. Very pleasant staff, chilled and relaxed atmosphere .. staff was willing to help with anything.  Don’t understand how people can complain with this place with the affordable price compared to the immaculate quality of clean rooms and various activities .. the area is great and this is like a hotel compared to many hostels in California.   Amazing amazing

Epic people at an epic place! The hotel has top services and facilities for its tier. The street art ALL around the hostel is inspiring and beautiful and contributes to a cool and creative ambiance. The staff os great too! Last but not least the amazing waves of Trestles are just minutes away!!!

Summary Heading: Nice kitchen with professional staff to offer free bagels and great coffee
Summary: I booked 8 nights and kept extending.  I wanted to try other hostels in Southern California but Trestles has a great mix of surfers, skateboarders and older folks like me of all races.  While I was there 3 surfers entered competitions along the coast.   I stayed 19 days because the bunks are made of wood and have thick curtains so it's dark and quiet day or night.  The bunks don't creak, they have a reading light inside so you can use your laptop.  The beach is an easy walk because the surfers walk over and back carrying their boards.  The 1 bus stops almost outside the door and goes all the way to Long Beach.  I either walked 35 minutes to San Clemente or took the 1 bus.

Very open and friendly environment. I didn't get any bad vibes from the staff or the guests. And I met some interesting people and had great conversations. They really want you to feel at home and I did.

The place is dump, I travel internationally, I stay in different hotels or hostels. Hostels in Europe are sometimes cleaner than some hotels. My international and very long flight arrived late at night , I must pay extra $5 for coming after 8pm.My bed was a futon with 0000 privacy. I come late and I went straight to sleep . Boy what suprice for me on the morning. I found out is a mix sex rooms, and was wired  guy .  I was on futon and have no privacy. I stuck because I paid on front and I was so tired and jag logged, have no other way only stay there for 3 nights.  They are friendly, but I booked place to sleep and be safe and comfortable. I booked the place through hotels.com and they had very positive rating. There was no warning the rooms are mix sex. The place is dirty, just
Manager Response: HI Margot, Our hearts broke to read your review. We are so sorry for providing such a terrible experience for you. We so rarely get anything except a 5 star review that we made your review a priority for identifying the issues you mentioned. I went on Hotels.com and while it does say Mixed Dorm, it may not be sufficiently clear what that means. We are requesting that Hotels.com update the information for clarity. Regarding the comments of cleanliness we have an intense daily regimen for cleaning that is process oriented and involves 3 shifts of cleaning. One in the morning from 7am to 10am cleaning common areas. Second, from 12pm-3pm cleaning rooms and the third from 10pm-1am cleaning common areas again. We have weekly quality control that inspects the facility and provides a written list of corrections that we use in training meetings. We obviously missed the mark with you and we are devastated. I hope we have the opportunity to make it up to you in the future. Hugs, Josh

Summary Heading: Great staff! Great Art! Great resting spaces a hidden Jewel!
Summary: My stay was one of the best experiences on this trip. The community of surfers and other visitors were friendly yet committed to my safety. I was in a room with 4 others, but the bunks are set up so well it’s like your own little private space. Great community of people a must stay place!

We stayed at the HOS for 2 nights at the beginning of March and had an amazing time there. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. We had some good conversations with the hosts and travelers as well. Everyone was super nice and relaxed. The coffee in the morning was really yummy and we loved that they had a great selection of surfboards to rent as well.  The Gallery Suite itself is pretty big and could easily accommodate 4 people. The beds were very comfi. There were small reading lamps next to each bed, and the main light/fan can be regulated with a remote- pretty neat. There’s cool street art everywhere and even a mini skate ramp.   We will definitely come back to stay here and have let our friends know about this place as well. Thanks so much again for your kind hospitality!

Summary Heading: Would give a zero and call BBB if I had more time and if 0 were an option of stars!
Summary: I had previous, phenomenal experiences here. This was no longer the case when Joshua the owner was out of Town and Jon, the so called house manager allowed his group of poorly educated, badly groomed, unkind, lower the goodness of this facility. I had zero indication that my stay would be mixed with a clearly inebriated staff member who chose to kick me out when I asked if he were on drugs/ made comment on that topic.  I did email House of Trestles but don't know if the email was disregarded as to not address a major issue in his business, just to be told by JON that the business if failing ( maybe because he is stealing money and allowing shady individuals free entry. Jon went through my things and when caught, he offered to move me to a nicer room cuz he was so in shock of
Manager Response: Hi Nick,  Any time a guest is asked to leave the staff member fill out an incident report. In this case I received two incident reports because of your negative interactions with two staff members. While investigating the incident report, I spoke with both employees and 4 guests. The reason you were asked to leave was for making inappropriate and hurtful comments to other guests. Like telling poor Max that his mother didn't love or want him, or telling Ryan that everyone talks behind his back and thinks he is annoying or telling everyone that Jon is on drugs (when you know he take pride in his sobriety). These toxic and painful attacks were hurtful and mean. They were unnecessary and false. As human beings it is our obligation to love others, not hurt them. This is a cornerstone of  House of Trestles. To be a place of healthy and meaningful relationships. I realize that being asked to leave can be an intense sense of rejection and for that I do apologize. While we have to take all guests experience into consideration, it is always difficult to ask a guest to leave. It is also a risk having retaliatory reviews. As this is a perfect case and point.   The sadness by all staff, in reading your review today was replaced with the reality that we will allow our actions to speak for us. That we will continue to love on guests and provide life changing experiences. Our ratings speak for themselves and our actions speak louder. Wishing you great peace and tranquility in your life. Hugs, Joshua

Summary: You won't understand what an incredible place this is until you meet the owner Josh and his beautiful family, the GM Jon with his dedication to kindness and professionalism, and the unbelievably cool people around here. You will grow. Thanks Josh and team for sacrificing so much to create a place like House of Trestles. God bless you.

Despite the fact that there was loads of availability they refused to refund my two night bed in a dorm when my plans changed...7 day notice no refund - have a nice day was their attitude... I am a silver surfer on holiday from the uk - heard so much about the California Spirit, very disappointing. Fortunately, I have found it elsewhere - in fact everywhere apart from the house of trestles.
Manager Response: Hi Simon, So sorry you feel we were unfair with you. We have a very liberal cancellation policy that allows guests to cancel, prior to 7 days of arrival. Totally understand your plans changed. We love our guests and stay as flexible as possible, at the same time some basic policies are required so that we can continue to keep the doors open and offer an incredible place to stay for our guests. Not sure how following our policy deems one star, but we love you just the same. So happy you found hospitable digs on your trip. Hugs, Josh

Summary: Honestly the best stay I've ever had at a hostel. The location is just across from a camping ground that leads to the most prolific view of a beach I've ever seen. The cliffs, surfers and sunset are awesome here. The check in was spot on, the minute I arrived I was greeted, made to feel welcome and loved, and totally enjoyed my experience. I got a firsthand tour, and spent several minutes getting to know the place and people who worked here. There are hostels you can go in and you know that you're just another spot filled. Here, I felt part of a culture and family. I met some of the locals and got to hang out with them-it was just one day! Went out, ate home made tacos, got a tour of the place, and even did some yoga just before my checkout! If you want a no drama, no hassle

Summary Heading: Good Overall Experience but not the Best
Summary: Pros:  Facilities were clean and beds were comfortable.   Nice shortboards for rent, a bit expensive but good quality.   Waves were good during my stay, Trestles and San Onofre’s are relatively close and very consistent.   Jon was awesome.   Cool art painted throughout the hostel. Guest artists stayed in the hostel making for cool conversation and vibes.  Breakfast is fruit, bagels and coffee.   Cons: At check in there were no rules listed or told to me about quiet hours. There is no place at the hostel to come back and hang out for the concern of being too loud and waking people up.  One of the Staff filmed my friends and I with their cell phone to get us in trouble for not going straight to bed after coming home on a Friday night.  No communal hostel activities for night time

This was my first time staying at a hostel and I must say it was memorable. My boyfriend and I are both Surfers and Paddle Boarders and this place had the right vibe.  Cleanliness is above average for a hostel yet there were certain areas of the facility that I believe could have been a bit more maintained for this truly 5 STAR hostel... one thing to consider is the turn around time in between bunks could have been a little longer so there was time to throughly clean between guests... ..  -The kitchen is a huge plus!  -everything you need to have a fun day (yoga, surfing , bike to rent, running paths near the hostel.. etc!) -Staff is very attentative and makes an effort to cover and questions you have and they work very hard! (The cleanliness is beyond the current staff hands

This was a great place to stay. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. It was very conveniently located close to trestles surf spots. All the rental gear was in great shape. I would definitely stay there again.

I've stayed at H.O.T several times and it's always been an awesome experience. The staff are friendly and ready to help. The rooms are cozy and comfy. Free coffee, bagels and cream cheese, hello. Don't miss out on a great experience. T

A real hostel in San Clemente! Hostel culture, good vibes, some people are living there but its different from most of the hostels in US... its really cool and good athmosphere. They have board rentals and surf classes. They have a lovely hammock at the smoking area. The staff is helpful and bed and shower are comfortable. Good location less than 10 min walking to the beach. I'll be back soon!!!

Hip and friendly place, the interior has some cool street art. We stayed in one if the shared rooms with bunk beds, which are pretty basic. I didn't had a chance to sneak a peak into one of their suites.  The best part are their rental surfboard selection. They have plenty of great Lost Mayham boards for rental. You can rent a bike with board rack and ride to any of the close surf spots (Trestles is about 15mins by bike).   The staff is super friendly, especially Jon. He is the best, always helpful and friendly.

Summary Heading: By far the best hostel I've ever stayed in!!!!
Summary: My first solo hostel stay & I lucked out! Super chilled environment, the staff and other guest all totally fitted the vibe. So easy to hang out in the lounge and a bunch of us even went for a last minute bonfire on the beach one night. The Location is perfect, about a 15 minute walk from the beach and a 15minute cycle into town (don't cycle to the beach.. the hills are unreal) The beds were really comfy, everywhere was kept very clean & you felt very safe. There was also great yoga classes regually. I highly highly recommend this place to stay if visiting San Clemente :) can I come back now?!

This was a first for our high school surf team.  We saw the House of Trestles online and thought it might be perfect for our group so we contacted Addison and Josh as we had a large group and some very specific requests.  We wanted the entire place, penthouse, suites and all and, while it was a learning curve for everyone because we were the first to do that, the end result was fantastic!!!!!  Addison did everything in his power to make our high school surfers feel welcome and part of his home.  He was a great host and could not have been nicer.  The place was incredible with a huge kitchen, half pipe and great beds.  The coaches stayed in the suite which was amazing.  We rented bikes for everyone and Addison cleared out the front room so we could store them safely.  The vibe

I booked in last minute alone when my LA accommodation fell through, and I couldn't have been happier with my stay! The owner and staff were SUPER helpful and friendly. Facilities were fantastic - with a private shower for females, bicycles for rent, cheap surfboard wax, surfing advice.... They even have free good quality coffee and fruit and bagles in the morning. I don't usually stay in hostels anymore, but I will definitely be coming back to House of Trestles. Thanks for a great stay guys!

Very cool hostel with an amazing interior look with lots of street art and cool decoration! Early check-in was not a problem (no other hostel was able to check me in earlier on my long trip so this is really special) and the staff was really helpful and friendly all the time. I felt really comfortable right from the beginning! All in all its a clean hostel and the "box-styled" beds with the curtains give you a lot of privacy even when you are in a shared room. Great place! I would definitely stay there again! :)

Conveniently located within easy walking/biking distance to Trestles surfing beach.  This place is clean , super friendly and cheap.  Job done in terms of shared accommodation.  It helps that they have a good array of the latest Lost surfboards and Rip Curl wetsuits if you are travelling without equipment.  Highly recommended spot.

Very good location across the freeway from San Clemente State Park, near San Onofre State Park, great for surfing, body-surfing, extremely friendly and helpful staff, very friendly and welcoming environment.

The staff at House of Trestles were great! Both staff and other hostel stayers were very welcoming and friendly. You get your own little 'booth-like' bunk bed that was perfect for having your own little space even though you were sharing the room with others. Very modern! The place was kept clean and tidy. Kitchen, living area and bathrooms were nice. Cool activities offered such as yoga. Just down the road from a convenience store and a 20 minute walk to a large supermarket.

Absolutely the best hostel in California! It’s super clean everyone is super nice and the beds are so comfortable! you will never want to leave! The owners are super nice! I’ll defiantly be back soon!

Summary Heading: A Chill Place to Call Home
Summary: I stayed here for a few days on a road trip and LOVED it! I've stayed in many hostels and this was my favorite by far. Everyone is very warm and welcoming, giving you your privacy while still making you feel like family. To top it all off, the place is decked out in amazing art, they offer surfing and yoga among other things, have hot coffee in the morning, and are literally a few blocks from the beach. I loved it so much I may detour my trip back that way just to go stay with them again.
Manager Response: We love you soooo much. Come back and hang out with us!!!

Summary: The House of Trestles is a hidden jewel in San Clemente for adventures of all ages and all walks of life. The staff is very warm and welcoming, they go above and beyond to make sure you feel like your part of the Trestle family. The price per night is outrageously low and includes a small continental breakfast in the morning. If you're like me and need a cup of Joe to wake up don't bother going to Starbucks, there coffee is spot on. They have an industrial stove and refrigerator so you can save even more money not having to go out to eat. Just go shopping and make your own food. Yoga is available for the early riser to kick start your day in the right direction and it is complimentary with your stay. If you want to learn to surf they guarantee in one session you'll be standing

Super friendly and helpful staff, nice and friendly crowd around, bagels and coffee for breakfast are a nice plus, comfy bed with curtain for privacy. Only stayed one night but would definitely recommend the place!

New hostel with a really cool, chilled out vibe. Definitely more of a lively hostel so great if you want to meet people! Though you can keep to yourself if you want as each room has a 'pod' style bed with curtains for individual privacy. Addison & Nichol were amazing, they put on a BBQ for us all - free of charge - and were really hospitable. Free breakfast is offered everyday, including amazing local coffee!The hostel rents bikes with board racks, boards & wetsuits at a good price. We had a great time, definitely one of the highlights of our California trip! Ps, Lola & Hank are the best dogs ever. Angi, Paula & Helen.
Manager Response: Hi Angi, Paula & Helen, Thanks so much for staying with us and the kind words. Look forward to your next stay with us. Cheers! Josh

Summary: Place is new, perfectly located, friendly staff. Bunk beds are clean. Feel the atmosphere and enter the hostel mood. Liked my stay a lot. San Clemente has a lot to offer, and it showed. November has good weather.

House of Trestles was awesome. The house is extremely well maintained and really is like living in a street art gallery. Bathrooms spotless; great kitchen facilities; bunks are handcrafted and very private. Super friendly vibe. Was a pleasure to meet and hang out briefly with the crew there. Great experience. Look forward to visiting in the future.

I happend to end up all by my self in California when I met u guy at a hostel I Los Angeles who recommended The House of trestles in San clemente. So I went there and it was awesome! Great people, warm atmoaphere, cosy bed with curtains so it's private.  I'm defenently going back!   Thanks!!!

Summary Heading: Am I allowed to give 0 out of 5
Summary: Management and staff do not listen to the guests. Guests are not always aware of the rules. Staff complains about the guests. Gossip in the community is out of control. Yoga classes were not offered. Surf classes were not offered.
Manager Response: Emilie, I am baffled by your review. you stayed for 2 nights/3 days. The second night we covered half the cost of your stay because you were short on funds. During your stay we fed you and showed you nothing, but kindness. The second night you started having some bizarre episode, with outbursts towards other guests. We worked to deescalate the situation. The third day you were walking the halls, talking to yourself and having outbursts. At one point cussing profanity in the hall-way. I informed you we would be unable to extend your stay, because of your behavior. I gave you an hour to pack your belonging and even helped you pack. During that time you started escalating, cussing at guests and staff. On the way out of the door you screamed "F you guys" and pulled the fire alarm, creating quite an ordeal. Last night we received a call from you like nothing had happened and asking if we had space for you. This was 2 days after you wrote this review. I am sorry that you are dealing with mental health challenges, but it is unacceptable how you behaved.

Summary: I came over from Ireland as a solo traveller. House of trestles was perfect, it would be impossible to stay here and feel lonely. The reason why I stay in hostels is to meet people from all walks of life and this place ticks that box. Easy going, chilled out and friendly. Even the neighbours are friendly. Had a good laugh with the boys up from Chili doing the art work (brilliant). Fully functional kitchen and fridges available to everyone. Clean bathrooms and showers. Come n go as you please.  Surrounded by surf breaks for every taste and capability. San Clemente is one of those places that makes you feel at home and house of trestles is no different. As the big guy says, I'll be back.

Summary Heading: It's not just a Hostel it's a family
Summary: House of Trestles makes you feel like you walked into your own living room from the second you walk in the door. People immediately want to know your name, accommodations are sparkling clean and tidy, and THE ART. As a local painter in SLC, I was basically in a fantasy world and could stare and the art forever, if I wasn't so busy surfing on the sick boards they have to offer. Josh and Addison are the sweetest men with incredible vision, who just want you to have the best time. They are authentic, compassionate, and incredibly wonderful. I stayed for the waves, but I'll be coming back for the people (okay also the waves but here you can have it all). See you soon HoT!

This place blew my expectations out of the water! From start to finish my experience at The house of Trestles was incredible. The art at this place is next level and I was inspired   by the messages they portrayed. All the rooms are beautifully designed and are all sponsored by brands in the surfing industry adding to the beachy vibe. THE KITCHEN IS AMAZING, best hostel kitchen i've been in. The common areas are comfortable spacious and filled with games connecting the melting pot of travelers. It seems like everyone is best friends at this modern, clean, beautiful surf hostel and I had an blast! It is close to bars, beaches, and some great food spots. Also, the coffee is incredible and I am stoked they are collaborating with Bear Flag coffee! Yoga every morning too, so epic.

I stayed at House of Trestles during the Hurley Pro and loved every minute of it.  Josh and Addison have created an incredible place that truly feels like home.  The place itself is clean, safe and beautiful as it is covered in incredible artwork.  Close to the beach and to Trestles, the area is perfect.  However, what makes this a standout place is the community of people it brings together.  Through morning yoga and nightly events, everyone is brought together and made to feel like family.  You are greeted and treated like family when you walk through the doors and by the time you leave you are already planning your next trip back.  Thanks for the incredible adventure, can't wait to come back! -Christina

Summary Heading: TOTALLY STOKED! FROTHING! THE PLACE TO BE IN SAN CLEMENTE!
Summary: House of Trestles could possibly be the best hostel I have ever stayed in.  It is brand spanking new and already super f-ing awesome.  They have local artists paint basically the whole place, then they do it again after every few months. The sponsored rooms are amazing! I got lucky and got in the VIssla room, I am a big fan of Vissla and how they have conducted business within the surf industry, plus their clothes are cool. I digress...the room was clean as hell, they have memory foam bed, plenty of privacy, and clean and comfy sheets! The hang out areas are chill and comfortable for all types of chillers, the kitchen is fully stocked and really big for plenty of chefs. But besides the amazing location to some of Southern California's best surf (for all skill levels) the best

I had no idea what to expect when I booked this place.  I was pleasantly surprised!!  Fun vibe, great location.  Very reasonably priced. All the boys are super cool and accommodating.  And the mascot dog, Hank, is awesome!!!  Highly recommend this brand new surf hostel.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in San Clemente!
Summary: House of Trestles is a hidden gem in San Clemente, CA.  The location is super close to amazing surf breaks!  The house vibe is cool and relaxed with featured street artists and surf brand sponsored rooms.  This was my first time staying in a hostel and I loved every minute of it. Bear Coast Coffee and Yoga in the morning and fun people to hang out with makes this a perfect spot. Thanks guys, you know I will be back!

The staff is super nice at the hostel and I met amazing people there and had a great time. The hostel has a great laid-back atmosphere and there were a lot of people to hang out with and go surf. They also rent boards and bikes.

This place is incredible, I was looking for a place close to the surfspot, and here it is, Super relaxed hostel, clean and with a lot of Art inside of it, the beds are closed with curtains, so it is kinda private, Super recommendable to stay for surfing or whatever you want, cool vibes here!
Manager Response: Thanks Federico. You are such an amazing light my friend. What an honor to spend time with you.

Summary: House of trestles is a very special place! Josh and his family were amazing hosts - it felt less like a hostel and more like I was going to stay at an old friends house for the weekend! Thank you for the hospitality and I'll be back soon 😊

Summary Heading: BEST WEEK EVER - welcoming, fun people & incredible space!
Summary: I am blown away with this hostel! Josh and his family are the most welcoming lovely people i've met. The hostel is very gorgeous and clean. It is a perfect place to hang out and meet other travellers!
Manager Response: Best week for us too! We loved having you and Maddy in town. Can't wait to see you again Jay! Please let us know when your Beach Day single is out. That's going to be a hit! We love you!!!
